alert.note: Alert for Hendricks; Johnson; Marion; Morgan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 6:01PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Morgan, northern Johnson, eastern Hendricks and Marion Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 600 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm cluster over central Hendricks County, or 12 miles west of downtown Indianapolis, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Plainfield around 605 PM EDT. Speedway around 610 PM EDT. Beech Grove around 620 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Southport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 97 and 124. Interstate 70 between mile markers 60 and 93. Interstate 74 between mile markers 63 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
